summary: This is an email chain between Parvin Daphne Moyne of Akin Gump law firm and an unnamed recipient, discussing an upcoming Wall Street Journal article about Jeffrey Epstein. The email flags that the article will mention Epstein's charity Gratitude America held accounts at Deutsche Bank, and offers to provide information ahead of a scheduled meeting.

persons.name: Parvin Daphne Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Author of the initial email, informing the recipient that Deutsche Bank has received information about an upcoming WSJ article mentioning Epstein and the bank's connection to his charity, Gratitude America.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming Wall Street Journal article. The email mentions he controlled a charity called Gratitude America which held accounts at Deutsche Bank.

connections.description: Moyne, as a lawyer, is communicating about legal/banking matters concerning Epstein and his charity's accounts at Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Upcoming WSJ Article on Epstein and Deutsche Bank
events.description: The Wall Street Journal is set to publish an article reporting that Jeffrey Epstein controlled a charity called Gratitude America, which held accounts at Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting/Proffer
events.description: A meeting or proffer session is scheduled for Thursday, September 12, 2019, where the topic of the WSJ article and Epstein's charity accounts at Deutsche Bank was to be covered.

locations: One Bryant Park, New York, NY 10036-6745 (Akin Gump office)
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank received information about an upcoming Wall Street Journal article related to Jeffrey Epstein that would mention the bank.
The article reported that Epstein controlled a charity called Gratitude America.
The charity Gratitude America held accounts at Deutsche Bank.
The communication is from a lawyer at Akin Gump, indicating legal representation or advisory involvement regarding the bank's connection to Epstein.
